intro: Eversmannia sarytavica, commonly known as the Sarytavica thistle, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to Central Asia and is characterized by its spiny, herbaceous stems and distinctive composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite head. Eversmannia sarytavica plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various insects and small animals.
